message.raw:
Revised installation script with the following changes:
  Fixed bug that allowed spaces in paths.
  Installed HDF5 version 1.8.2->1.8.4
  Explicit PyTables installer (rather than just using setup.py 'requires')
    to make sure it is installed **before** the program of interest.
    This will be more important once we upgrade to PyTables 2.2, since
    that version has dependencies that aren't listed in its setup.py,
    and thus must be managed separately (Cython, numexpr, numpy).
  Changed check_version() interface.
  Updated the way versions are extracted from URLs, to allow hyphens in the
    version number (rather than in the program name, as was previously the case)
message.html:
Revised installation script with the following changes:
Fixed bug that allowed spaces in paths.
Installed HDF5 version 1.8.2->1.8.4
Explicit PyTables installer (rather than just using setup.py 'requires')
to make sure it is installed before the program of interest.
This will be more important once we upgrade to PyTables 2.2, since
that version has dependencies that aren't listed in its setup.py,
and thus must be managed separately (Cython, numexpr, numpy).
Changed check_version() interface.
Updated the way versions are extracted from URLs, to allow hyphens in the
version number (rather than in the program name, as was previously the case)

summary.raw:
Revised installation script with the following changes:
  Fixed bug that allowed spaces in paths.
  Installed HDF5 version 1.8.2->1.8.4
  Explicit PyTables installer (rather than just using setup.py 'requires')
    to make sure it is installed **before** the program of interest.
    This will be more important once we upgrade to PyTables 2.2, since
    that version has dependencies that aren't listed in its setup.py,
    and thus must be managed separately (Cython, numexpr, numpy).
  Changed check_version() interface.
  Updated the way versions are extracted from URLs, to allow hyphens in the
    version number (rather than in the program name, as was previously the case)
summary.html:
Revised installation script with the following changes:
Fixed bug that allowed spaces in paths.
Installed HDF5 version 1.8.2->1.8.4
Explicit PyTables installer (rather than just using setup.py 'requires')
to make sure it is installed before the program of interest.
This will be more important once we upgrade to PyTables 2.2, since
that version has dependencies that aren't listed in its setup.py,
and thus must be managed separately (Cython, numexpr, numpy).
Changed check_version() interface.
Updated the way versions are extracted from URLs, to allow hyphens in the
version number (rather than in the program name, as was previously the case)

values.message:
Revised installation script with the following changes:
  Fixed bug that allowed spaces in paths.
  Installed HDF5 version 1.8.2->1.8.4
  Explicit PyTables installer (rather than just using setup.py 'requires')
    to make sure it is installed **before** the program of interest.
    This will be more important once we upgrade to PyTables 2.2, since
    that version has dependencies that aren't listed in its setup.py,
    and thus must be managed separately (Cython, numexpr, numpy).
  Changed check_version() interface.
  Updated the way versions are extracted from URLs, to allow hyphens in the
    version number (rather than in the program name, as was previously the case)

message.raw:
bed.get_trackline_and_reader: handle missing tracklines
_util.maybe_gzip_open: allow "-" as a filename
segway-layer: add a default trackline, allow non-integer names, allow I/O from stdin/stdout

setup: switch from path.py to forked-path

so importing from Genomedata._util is no longer necessary.

message.raw:
* segway: a change in the semantics of --trainable-params for
  training. If it is specified and the file exists, then it will be
  used as a parameter file in the first round of training. Before it
  was clobbered (with --clobber), or training was disabled.
* segway: allow multiple sets of parameters with --trainable-params,
  one for each random start. This together with the previous change
  will allow for the easy continuation of a multithread training run.
* run.py: change start_index to thread_index throughout
message.html:
• segway: a change in the semantics of --trainable-params for
    training. If it is specified and the file exists, then it will be
    used as a parameter file in the first round of training. Before it
    was clobbered (with --clobber), or training was disabled.
  • segway: allow multiple sets of parameters with --trainable-params,
    one for each random start. This together with the previous change
    will allow for the easy continuation of a multithread training run.
  • run.py: change start_index to thread_index throughout

summary.raw:
* segway: a change in the semantics of --trainable-params for
  training. If it is specified and the file exists, then it will be
  used as a parameter file in the first round of training. Before it
  was clobbered (with --clobber), or training was disabled.
* segway: allow multiple sets of parameters with --trainable-params,
  one for each random start. This together with the previous change
  will allow for the easy continuation of a multithread training run.
* run.py: change start_index to thread_index throughout

    training. If it is specified and the file exists, then it will be
    used as a parameter file in the first round of training. Before it
    was clobbered (with --clobber), or training was disabled.
  • segway: allow multiple sets of parameters with --trainable-params,
    one for each random start. This together with the previous change
    will allow for the easy continuation of a multithread training run.
  • run.py: change start_index to thread_index throughout
